review.title: Intelligent information extraction based on artificial neural network
review.abstract: Question Answering System (QAS) is used for information retrieval and natural language processing (NLP) to reduce human effort. There are numerous QAS based on the user documents present today, but they all are limited to providing objective answers and process simple questions only. Complex questions cannot be answered by the existing QAS, as they require interpretation of the current and old data as well as the question asked by the user. The above limitations can be overcome by using deep cases and neural network. Hence we propose a modified QAS in which we create a deep artificial neural network with associative memory from text documents. The modified QAS processes the contents of the text document provided to it and find the answer to even complex questions in the documents.

metadata.title: INTELLIGENT INFORMATION EXTRACTION BASED ON ARTIFICIAL NEURAL NETWORK

sections.text: DOI: 10.5121 / ijfcst.2016.6108 95Question Answering System (QAS) is used to obtain information and process natural language (NLP) in order to reduce human effort. There are numerous QAS based on the user documents available today, but all are limited to providing objective answers and processing simple questions. Complex questions cannot be answered by the existing QAS because they require an interpretation of current and old data as well as the question posed by the user. The above limitations can be overcome by using deep cases and neural networks. Therefore, we propose a modified QAS in which we create a deep artificial neural network with associative memory from text documents. The modified QAS processes the content of the text document provided to it and finds the answer to even complex questions in the documents.KEYWORDSQuestion Answering System, Natural Language Processing, Artificial Network.

sections.heading: 1. INTRODUCTION
sections.text: NLP is a critical component of artificial intelligence. NLP can be used to understand and process the knowledge provided to the system [1]. NLP improvises the system and causes it to behave humanely when properly programmed. QAS is used for fast information extraction, freeing the user from reading unnecessary information that may not lead to the answer. QAS has various NLP models that are used. These models are symbol comparisons where they use linguistic annotations, structured world knowledge and semantic parsing [2]. There are different types of symbolic comparison models such as the frame semantic parsing method, the word distance benchmark method [3]. These methods are not effective because they are only able to answer simple questions.

sections.heading: 2. ARTIFICIAL NEURAL NETWORK
sections.text: Artificial Neural Network (ANN) is made up of interconnected processors called neurons. Each neuron processes information and passes it on to the next neurons. It is designed to function in a similar way to the human brain. In this proposed QAS, we use neural networks to store and query information. We try to mimic the information characteristics of humans by linking the information associated with them. The strength of the connection between the two units of knowledge is directly related to the relationship between them. The neural network represents the information understood by the system. ANN has been used to solve various tasks that are difficult to solve in the field of machine learning, such as speech recognition, handwriting and answering questions. ANN can be used to store the previously processed information and can later be used for knowledge conclusions.

sections.heading: 2.1. Natural Language Processing
sections.text: NLP is an area of artificial intelligence, cognitive science and computational linguistics. It plays an important role in human-computer interaction. A computer only understands 1 and 0, and humans interact with each other using natural language. In order for a computer to understand and process the language used by the human NLP, it is necessary. The document provided to QAS contains data in natural language so that the QAS can process the content of the document and generate ANN; we use NLP. We used the following NLP functions. Part 1 of Language (POS) Tagging It is used to label words from sentences with language components such as noun, verb, adverb, etc. Example: "Popeye eats spinach" nouns - Popeye and spinach. Verb - eats.2. Entity Recognition It is used to classify bandatomic elements in sentences into categories such as person, place, time, etc.: "Gandhiji Porhiar Porhi Porhi Porhi Porhi Person" was born in bandbandatomic tape recorder.

sections.heading: 2.2. Deep Neural Network
sections.text: In processing natural language, we can take advantage of the properties of the Deep Neural Network (DNN), which contains several hidden layers, and such layers can help identify the relationship between different units of knowledge and generate answers at the same time.Two neurons do not appear to be directly connected to each other in a simple ANN, but are indirectly connected via DNN. Such indirect relationships can be found when we construct a DNN for the same thing. Suppose we want to find out if two people belong to the same village. We can assume that if there are blood relationships between the two, they belong to the same village.The knowledge provided may not provide sufficient information about the blood relationship. ANN is constructed only by the data provided to the system. DNN can be used to go beyond the data provided to the system and identify the relationship between the two individuals.

sections.heading: 3. INTELLIGENT INFORMATION EXTRACTION SYSTEM
sections.text: The proposed QAS consists of two phases: learning and extraction. The system learns when new information is fed to it. During learning, new neurons (words) or connections between neurons are added to the existing network. When a question is asked to the system, it switches to the second phase to extract the answer to the question asked. The block diagram of the proposed QAS is shown in Figure 1.

sections.heading: 3.1. Sentence Analysis
sections.text: This step involves the processing of natural language, in which we derive units of knowledge from sentences and words (neurons) from the unit of knowledge.

sections.heading: 3.2. Assigning Deep Case
sections.text: We assign deep cases to the neurons in the artificial neural network in order to improve its consequence capability. The deep cases we will consider are shown below in Table 1.

sections.heading: 3.3. Network Creation
sections.text: After sentence analysis, we form an artificial neural network from the extracted words. If words exist in the same unit of knowledge, we establish a connection between them.

sections.heading: 3.4. Question Analysis
sections.text: In question analysis, it can be estimated from the nature of the question asked which answer should be extracted, for example, if the question contains "where," then the answer will contain a place. Words from the question are also extracted to search the neurons and the connection between them.

sections.heading: 3.5. Search in Neural Network
sections.text: The neurons (words) extracted from the question analysis are searched in ANN to find connections between them, which leads to the knowledge layer.

sections.heading: 3.6. Backtrack to Knowledge Layer
sections.text: This step involves generating a unit of knowledge that may be the answer to the question asked by the user.

sections.heading: 4. RESULT
sections.text: We have conducted an experiment to provide QAS with a document containing the details of Mahatma Gandhi. Step 1: In this step, we take input sentences (text data) from the user. Let's say document contains the following details. "Gandhiji was born in Porbandar on October 2, 1869." Step 2: In this step, we divide the input sentences into words and assign a unique ID to each word. Step 4: In this step, we assign a word type to each word. The mapping of each word type is shown in Table 4.Step 3: Now we assign deep cases to each word. Table 5 shows the various deep cases associated with each word. Step 6: In this step, we define the relationship between words and units of knowledge. Row 1 in Table 6 shows that ID1 and ID2 are related sentences to each word.

sections.heading: 5. CONCLUSION
sections.text: The proposed system overcomes the problems encountered in current systems to answer the complex question from the text document provided by the user. The proposed system solves this problem by assigning a deep case to each neuron, which improves the ability to answer more complex questions.

sections.heading: ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS
sections.text: Our thanks go to M.H. Saboo Siddik College of Engineering, Department of Computer Engineering, for the constructive work initiative and anonymous reviewers for their constructive suggestions.

The above limitations can be overcome by using deep cases and neural network.
